ARABIC: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِٱلْغَمَٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ ٱلْمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: the Day when Heaven is split apart in clouds, and the angels are sent down rank upon rank.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The day the heavens splits asunder with a dazzling white cloud gathering and the angels descend in a continuous stream,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day, a cloud will appear rending the sky and the angels will be senthi down rank after rank.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day the sky will be crystal blue, clear of clouds. The angels will descend in groups
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the day when the sky will be split asunder with clouds and the angels will be sent down in full.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) the Day when the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and the angels will be sent down, with a grand descending.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And on the day when the heaven shall burst asunder with the clouds, and the angels shall be sent down descending (in ranks).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Upon the day that heaven is split asunder with the clouds and the angels are sent down in majesty,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and the angels will be sent down, a grand descent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: On a Day when the sky will split open with its clouds and the angels are sent down rank upon rank,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And on the Day whereon the heaven shall be rent asunderg from the q clouds and the angelhall be sent downll with a great descending.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: The day when the sky with its clouds will be split open, and the angels will be sent down [in a majestic] descent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and angels shall be sent down, descending (in ranks),-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) the Day when the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and the angels will be sent down, with a grand descending.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day, the heaven is split asunder with clouds and the angels are sent down in majesty,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Day when the sky is cleft with clouds, and the angels are sent down in streams.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [25:25] And on the day when the heaven, each of the [seven] heavens, will be split asunder with the clouds, in other words, [split asunder] together with them [the clouds] (al-ghamām is white cloud) and the angels will be sent down, from every heaven, in a [majestic] descent, and this is the Day of Resurrection (it [yawma, ‘on the day’] is in the accusative because of an implied [preceding] udhkur, ‘mention’; a variant reading [for tashaqqaqu] is tashshaqqaqu, ‘will be split asunder’, where the second tā’ [of the original form tatashaqqaqu] has been assimilated with it the [the shīn]; another variant reading [instead of nuzzila almalā’ikatu, ‘the angels will be sent down’] has nunzilu al-malā’ikata, ‘We will send down the angels’);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder) for the descent of Allah and this descent is without any modality (bi-la kayf) (and the angels will be sent down, a grand descent) one after another.
